knimeNode.name: SQL Query
knimeNode.shortDescription: apply a SQL Query to every row of the input table

fullDescription.intro:
apply a SQL Query to every row of the input table.
Example Example1:
select chrom,chromStart from hg19.snp132 where name= ?ID limit 1 Example2:
select name from hg19.snp132 where chrom= ?CHROM and chromStart <=( ?POS -1 ) and ( ?POS -1 ) < chromEnd limit 1
References
Knime4Bio. Author: Pierre Lindenbaum PhD, INSERM UMR 915, Institut du thorax, Nantes. Reference: manuscript in preparation. Please, report any problem here.
fullDescription.option: The SQL query. Words starting with ?columnName will be replace by the content of the table. Don't put a semi colon at the end of the query. Example: Select chrom as C,chromStart as S,chromEnd as E where name= ?SNP.
JDBC uri. For the ucsc data it is: jdbc:mysql://genome-mysql.cse.ucsc.edu/hg19
JDBC user. For the ucsc data it is: "genome"
JDBC password. For the ucsc data it is empty
